title: Intermittency analysis in relativistic hydrodynamic simulations of heavy-ion collision at FAIR energies
text:
Abstract
In this paper, we present comprehensive results on intermittency using the Scaled Factorial Moment (SFM) technique in Au + Au collisions in the FAIR energy range of 2‚Äì12A GeV in pseudorapidity , azimuthal, and pseudorapidity-azimuthal spaces. The simulations are performed with a hybrid version of the Ultra-relativistic Quantum Molecular Dynamics (UrQMD) event generator. Three alternative equations of state (EoS) are employed to investigate the intermittency within the hydrodynamic scenario, namely pure Hadron Gas (HG), Chiral + HG, and Bag Model EoS. In both one and two-dimensional spaces and at all beam energies, a weak intermittent type of emission has been seen for Chiral+HG EoS. In contrast, a strong intermittent kind of emission is observed for Bag Model EoS. The incident beam energy dependency of intermittency has also been investigated. The strength of the intermittency is seen to diminish with increasing beam energy.

title: Intermittency analysis in relativistic hydrodynamic simulations of heavy-ion collision at FAIR energies

title: Omveer Singh, PhD
text:
E-mail
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  

  
  

Profile
I am a researcher and scientific software engineer with 8+ years of experience working with large-scale scientific data, detector simulations, and reproducible analysis pipelines.
I specialize in transforming complex datasets into reliable, actionable insights through well-engineered workflows, developed within international collaborations such as CBM/FAIR, GSI Helmholtz Centre, and Goethe University Frankfurt.


Research & Data Analytics Expertise

Data analysis, exploratory statistics, and modeling using Python (pandas, NumPy, SciPy) and ROOT

Querying and analyzing structured datasets using SQL

Data cleaning, transformation, and validation across heterogeneous data sources

Scientific software development in C++ and Python

Reproducible workflows, CMake-based builds, CI/CD, and automated testing

Data visualization and reporting for clear technical and non-technical communication



What I Work On

Designing reliable data analysis pipelines for large and complex datasets

Validating simulations and experimental data through statistical analysis

Building maintainable scientific software used by distributed research teams

Applying physics-informed data analysis techniques to real-world problems

Tech stack: Python ¬∑ SQL ¬∑ C++ ¬∑ Git ¬∑ Linux ¬∑ ROOT ¬∑ CMake ¬∑ CI/CD
